subject: Data
title: Reading a Data Table Without Getting Lost
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Reading a Data Table Without Getting Lost.

hook.text: A government report drops a 50-row table. Most people skip it. Data-literate people find the story in seconds.

buildup.text: Start with the column headers â€” they tell you what's being measured. Then find the rows that matter most.

discovery.text: Look for the extremes: highest, lowest, biggest change. That's where the story usually lives.

twist.text: Units matter enormously. Millions vs. billions, dollars vs. euros, annual vs. monthly â€” one misread changes everything.

climax.text: Reading tables fluently is the equivalent of reading a language. Practice makes the numbers speak.

punchline.text: Tables aren't walls of numbers. They're stories in rows.

quiz.question: What should you check first when reading a data table?
options: The column headers and units of measurement
